intro: Tetrastigma funingense, commonly known as the Funing vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grape family (Vitaceae) and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its berries are typically red or black when mature and contain several seeds. Tetrastigma funingense is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
